p: Sepsis is defined as life-threatening organ dysfunction caused by a dysregulated host response to infection. 1 In 2017, approximately 48.9 million sepsis cases and 11.0 million sepsis-related deaths were recorded worldwide, accounting for 19.7% of all global deaths. 2 According to a recently published systematic review, sepsis with organ dysfunction occurring during hospitalization affects 24.4% of all patients in intensive care units and neonatal intensive care units. 3 Septic shock is defined as sepsis complicated by hyperlactatemia and simultaneous hypotension requiring vasopressin therapy.
